meanings.definition: To steer a vehicle inadequately in a turn, causing it to follow a wider arc than intended.
meanings.sent1: The driver understeered around the corner and almost hit the curb.
meanings.sent2: She realized she understeered when the car didn't turn as sharply as she wanted.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy driver understeered and ended up in the parking lot instead of the street.
meanings.sent4: His lack of experience with the new car made him understeer through the sharp bend.
meanings.sent5: The icy road made it easy to understeer, so she had to be extra cautious.
